Keyboard users cannot activate this element How to fix: - Add (keydown.enter) or (keydown.space) handler - Use <button> instead of <div> or <span> - Add tabindex="0" and keyboard event handlers WCAG 2.1.1: Keyboard Found: <div> (line 1) (C:/Users/spani/OneDrive/Dokumente/GitHub/noro-wedding/src/app/components/image-preview/image-preview.html:1) [clickWithoutRole] Clickable element missing role. Screen readers cannot identify the element as interactive How to fix: - Use semantic element: <button>, <a>, <input> - Add role="button" with tabindex="0" - Add appropriate ARIA role WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value Found: <div> (line 1) (C:/Users/spani/OneDrive/Dokumente/GitHub/noro-wedding/src/app/components/image-preview/image-preview.html:1) [matIconAccessibility] mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons How to fix: - Add aria-label to parent button - Add visually-hidden text - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility Found: <mat-icon class="zoom-icon">zoom_in</mat-icon> (C:/Users/spani/OneDrive/Dokumente/GitHub/noro-wedding/src/app/components/image-preview/image-preview.html:1)

Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons How to fix: - Add aria-label to parent button - Add visually-hidden text - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility Found: <mat-icon matPrefix>description</mat-icon> [matIconAccessibility] mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons How to fix: - Add aria-label to parent button - Add visually-hidden text - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility Found: <mat-icon>refresh</mat-icon> [matIconAccessibility] mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons How to fix: - Add aria-label to parent button - Add visually-hidden text - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility Found: <mat-icon>{{ icon }}</mat-icon> [matIconAccessibility] mat-icon used as interactive without accessible label. Screen readers cannot announce icon-only buttons How to fix: - Add aria-label to parent button - Add visually-hidden text - Add aria-hidden="true" if purely decorative WCAG 4.1.2: Name, Role, Value | See: https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview#accessibility Found: <mat-icon>open_in_new</mat-icon>

testcase.name: /konto/konto-loeschen
testcase.system-out: Warnings (not failing): [headingOrder] Heading skips from h1 to h3. Screen reader users rely on heading hierarchy for navigation How to fix: - Use h2 instead of h3 - Restructure content to follow logical hierarchy WCAG 1.3.1: Info and Relationships Found: <h3>
